programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live S4
programme.desc: Conversation, advice and great company to make your morning.

programme.title: Moment of Proof S3 (5/15)
programme.desc: Fingerprints found after a break-in and brutal beating lead detectives to a murderer.

programme.title: Animal Park S32
programme.desc: Ben spends time with two of the oldest and grumpiest residents of the park.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (77/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Dover, Barnsley and Cockermouth.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt S60
programme.desc: Join Natasha Raskin Sharp from Worcester. The teams battle it out with expert help from Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks before heading to the auction in Staffordshire. Natasha also visits a rare collection of Traveller caravans.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Hope Street S2 (3/10)
programme.desc: When an ATM machine is stolen, new detective Al crosses a line to save someone he loves.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S2
programme.desc: Today in the Repair Shop, Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Gramophone expert Tim Weeks tackles a portable Peter Pan gramophone that has seen better days. No longer able to spin records, will Tim be able to fix it so that it can play music once more? Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary and carpenter William Kirk team up to mend a child's rocking chair. With a little care and attention the chair is mended, polished and re-covered and fit to sit in once more. Meanwhile, resident clock restorer Steven Fletcher turns his hand to mending a broken vintage cash register that has been in the owner's family business for generations.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S19 (51/70)
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple make a new start in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip S24 (25/25)
programme.desc: Charles and Raj's Welsh showdown. Will a bronze deity or a tea set make the most profit?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies S1
programme.desc: Ross Kemp presents as a team of four work colleagues - Tarlochan, Barry, Robert and Craig - take on the Bridge of Lies. One by one they all face the bridge, choosing who faces each crossing depending on the question category. Each bridge crossing has 32 potential steps - 22 truths and 10 lies - and they must cross by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies, earning money for each correct answer. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful will join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the cash.

programme.title: Pointless S26
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: A Question of Sport S52
programme.desc: Host Paddy McGuinness and team captains Sam Quek and Ugo Monye are joined by boxing world champion Anthony Crolla, sports broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal-winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings.

programme.title: Beyond Paradise S1 (5/6)
programme.desc: Humphrey and his team are stumped by a serial arson case with a bizarre twist.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You? S16
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell are joined by guests Tom Allen, Sarah Greene, Ugo Monye and Morgana Robinson. They reveal extraordinary stories about themselves, but are they telling the truth or making it all up?

programme.title: The Cleaner (The Clown) S2 (2/6)
programme.desc: «The Clown»Wicky is called to a theatre where a male strip show has got out of hand.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts. High-flying businessman Edward flees a boring party in his friend's sports car and runs into down-on-her-luck escort Vivian. As he's only in town for a few days, he hires her to keep him company. However, things become complicated when they fall for each other.
